Oxidized PAs (PA N-oxides, Fig.Â 1) are present in plants in nearly equal quantities as free base PAs
51 . The toxicity of PA N-oxides has been demonstrated but most are suggested to be less toxic than the PAs from which they originate
42, 51, 52 . However, metabolic reduction of N-oxides to their corresponding free base PAs has been reported to take place in the gut of animals
42, 53 . Studies on human liver microsomal system confirm that the results from animal studies are also relevant to humans
18, 51, 54 . N-oxides are more polar than free base PAs, implying potentially greater aquatic emissions from plants and a higher mobility in soils and sediments.
